subject: Programming
title: Best, Worst, and Average Cases
description: One-minute skill: Best, Worst, and Average Cases.

hook.text: An algorithm that's fast on one input can be painfully slow on another.

buildup.text: Computer scientists analyze three scenarios: best case, worst case, and average case.

discovery.text: Worst case guarantees a ceiling. If the worst is acceptable, everything else will be too.

twist.text: Average case is often more useful but harder to calculate. It depends on input distribution.

climax.text: Best case is misleading. An algorithm that shines on lucky inputs may choke on real data.

punchline.text: Plan for the worst. Hope for the average.
